captions.text:
Hey guys, I'm Tom Phillips and welcome to
Five Things. In case you haven't heard, WWE

Network has added every single episode of
Clash of the Champions. Clash of the Champions

was WCW's version of Saturday Night Main Event
and featured the best WCW had to offer. Today

we're looking at 5 matches you must check
out!

Number 1 is from the first ever Clash of the
Champions, it's Sting versus Ric Flair. Their

rivalry spanned almost an entire decade and
was the final match in WCW history. This specific

meeting lasted nearly 45 minutes and was considered
by many as Match of the Year.

Ric Flair also comes in at number 2. His 2
out of 3 falls match with Ricky Steamboat

is one of their best matches. Fun fact, this
show took place at the home of WrestleMania

30, The Superdome.
Ricky "The Dragon" Steamboat gets a second

match on this list at number 3. Steamboat
and "Stone Cold" Steve Austin had classic

matches and 2 of their best took place at
Clash of the Champions. They first met in

1992 but we're looking at their 1994 match
instead. As it turned out, this would be The

Dragon's final match for nearly 15 years.
We're going to stick to "Stone Cold" Steve

Austin for number 4. Austin and Brian Pillman
were known as the Hollywood Blondes and in

1993 they challenged Arn Anderson and the
returning Ric Flair.  That is the thrid time for Ric Flair on this list.

This awesome match is known for being the first time in 2 years
Ric Flair competed in a WCW ring.

Number 5 is Rey Mysterio facing Dean Malenko
in 1996. Mysterio and Malenko stole the show

and this match is a great example of why the
Cruiserweights were a must-see division in

WCW.
Well there are five Clash of the Champions

matches you must check out. WCW aired 35 Clash
of the Champions meaning there are hundreds

of new matches to binge watch on the WWE Network.
I'm Tom Phillips, thanks for joining me today
on Five Things.

title: 5 Awesome Clash of the Champions Matches - 5 Things
